title: Luca Postiglione
text:
Luca Postiglione (October 18, 1876 in <a href="Naples">Naples</a> – 1936) was an Italian painter, mainly of portraits, and historic and <a href="Genre%20paintings">genre</a> subjects, in a <a href="Realism%20%28arts%29">Realist</a> style.
He was the son of the painter <a href="Luigi%20Postiglione">Luigi Postiglione</a>. His elder brother, <a href="Salvatore%20Postiglione">Salvatore Postiglione</a> was also a painter and his teacher. Luigi's uncle, <a href="Raffaele%20Postiglione">Raffaele</a> (1818–1897) was a professor at the Neapolitan Institute of Fine Arts.
Among his works are "L'orfana" exhibited at the Italian Exhibition in London in 1904, while "Il giglio", and "La Soglia" were exhibited at the International Exposition in Rome in 1906.
